{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3546754,"name":"Daina","username":"PooBerry","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/858c86/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T00:40:50.226Z","cooked":"

Hello!
I’m trying to configure my Vivid Hosting Radio after competition but every time I reconfigure on the Wi-fi, it does not work. I’ve tried reconfiguring it several times and it says it’s secure on the vivid hosting configuring page but when I try to connect to it on WiFi, it says “can’t connect to that network”. Does anybody else have this issue after competition and can help?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-04T00:40:50.226Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":27,"reads":116,"readers_count":115,"score":158.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494118,"topic_slug":"vivid-hosting-radio-not-able-to-connect","display_username":"Daina","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57163,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"PooBerry"},"post_url":"/t/vivid-hosting-radio-not-able-to-connect/494118/1","custom_user_title":"PooBerry","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3546776,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T01:02:31.338Z","cooked":"

Do you have any screenshots?

Are you clicking “ok” or I accept or some such when it pops up that you are potentially overwriting the competition config?

Have you turned back ON DIP switch #3 for the 2.4GHz radio? That would have been turned OFF for competition.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-04T01:02:48.189Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":22.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494118,"topic_slug":"vivid-hosting-radio-not-able-to-connect","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vivid-hosting-radio-not-able-to-connect/494118/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3561175,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T22:20:23.286Z","cooked":"

Please reply with screenshots or a video of what you are doing.

Are you trying to use the 2.4ghz network?

You need to put passwords (WPA keys) in for BOTH 6 and 2.4 for it to return “success” on the config page. Otherwise it will return “bad” with some error message about expecting a password for the other network

We’re trying to use the 2.4ghz network, we already put in a key for both and it returned success.

Make sure you type the exact same WPA key in, capitalization and all, as the SSID password when trying to connect with your laptop.
